III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 0 touches Youth N's breasts under her clothes every
weekend and threatened to harm her if she told.
Investigation History:
It should be noted that on 6/26/23 DCWL received a similar
allegation made by Youth N that Staff 0 touched her breasts, and
the matter was investigated in SIR 2023C0000563. At that time
an incident report dated 6/23/23 indicated Youth N was in her
room alone and screamed for Staff 0 to “stop touching” her. Youth
N was interviewed at Kids-Talk on 7/27/24. There was no staff
named Staff 0 working at Vista Maria and no evidence any male
staff sexually abused her.
Prior to receiving this allegation, I interviewed Youth N at the
hospital on 2/1/24 concerning another allegation she made
against Vista Maria staff that was not supported by the evidence.
During that interview, Youth N did not mention a staff named Staff
0 at Vista Maria had touched her sexually.
I collaborated with Government Worker 1 who stated Government
Worker 2 completed a well-being check on Youth N at hospital on
2/13/24. Interviews pertaining to this sexual abuse allegation
were suspended pending a decision from law enforcement.
According to Government Worker 1, there is still an open
investigation alleging Youth N was abused prior to coming into
care. A Kids-Talk interview was scheduled on 2/27/24 to address
both allegations.
2

On 2/12/24 Government Worker 1 safety planned with the agency.
It was agreed that if or when Youth N was released from the
hospital, any staff named Staff 0 would not be alone with youths,
enter their rooms or have any contact with Youth N pending the
outcome of the investigation.
Kids-Talk Interview:
Youth N was interviewed by Forensic Interviewer (FI) at Kids-Talk
on 2/27/24 with me and Government Worker 1 observing from
another room via live video. The interview began at 10:05am and
ended at 10:59am. FI explained the ground rules, tested her
understanding, and engaged in rapport-building with Youth N.
Youth N said she had Kids-Talk interviews twice before and came
into care because her “stepdad was abusing” her and her siblings.
Youth N shared her likes and dislikes, and admitted she often
feels self-conscious, overwhelmed, mistrustful and easily angered.
She said she “keeps to herself” at Vista Maria and feels safe
there. FI asked Youth N to provide more details about her stay at
Vista Maria.
ALLEGED INCIDENT 1
Youth N stated in August 2023 in her room on midnight shift…No,
during change of shift around 7pm or 8pm, I felt like they were
touching me inappropriately. I tried to explain to staff how I felt.
They called a ‘clear (the area).’ I threw things. A male staff
restrained me. He was touching up here (pointing to her chest
area) and down my thighs and stuff…I had pants on. He touched
my clothes.” Asked who restrained her, Youth N answered “Staff
0 and Supervisor. They tried to grab me by my arms. Staff 1
stood there. I fell. When I fall, they can’t restrain me. I told them
to stop. Don’t touch me. Staff 0 picked me up from the floor like
this.” (Youth N demonstrated how Staff 0 slid his arms under her
armpits while lifting her and his hands/arms came in contact with
the sides and undersides of her breasts). “He also touched,
rubbed and pulled the top of my thigh to get me up.”
ALLEGED INCIDENT 2
Youth N said a month ago when she was in her room self-harming
with screws, Staff 0 “touched” and “tried to touch her in the same
places.” That time Staff 0 and Former Staff 2 were present and
“kept grabbing my hands because I didn’t want to live anymore.”
“I yelled and stuff…I was on the chair reaching for screws. He
picked me up under my arms and grabbed my legs…He came
from behind me and almost touched me. I kicked him in the
stomach. Former Staff 2 was also trying to restrain me, but she
couldn’t.”
3

ALLEGED INCIDENT 3
Youth N said a couple weeks ago, Staff 0 touched her
inappropriately a third time. Youth N said she was in the
bathroom breaking shower curtains when “he came in again and
touched me trying to restrain me.” Again, she demonstrated how
Staff 0 came behind her and tried to lift her up and pushed her
breasts up from underneath. “I faced the wall, and he was on the
side and back of me sort of pushing me against the wall. Staff 2
was there…They had me talking to a CPS worker then.”
Youth N was asked to describe the physical characteristics of
Staff 0. She said he is a tall thin white male in his 30s or 40s with
black hair in a “buzz cut.” She did not know him to go by any
other names. “He worked there before I got there. I don’t like
him. He picks up dayshifts. I’ve seen him watch the kids and
write it down every 15 minutes.”
Documents reviewed:
I reviewed Youth N’s Vista Maria psychiatric evaluation dated
12/11/23 which diagnosed her with Post Traumatic Stress
Disorder and Mood Dysregulation Disorder.
I reviewed Youth N’s discharge paperwork from Kingswood
Hospital dated 2/15/24. She was diagnosed with Post Traumatic
Stress Disorder, Severe Episode of Major Depression without
Psychotic Features and Borderline Personality Traits, along with a
maternal history of bipolar disorder and schizophrenia.
I reviewed Youth N’s psychotropic medication list. She is currently
prescribed Zoloft and Ability for mood, Vistaril for agitation and
Intuniv for problems with attention.
I reviewed two incident reports dated 9/6/23 and 1/26/24 that
somewhat resembled the events described Youth N in ALLEGED
INCIDENT 1 and ALLEGED INCIDENT 2 above. There were no
incident reports found matching the events or staff described in
ALLEGED INCIDENT 3.
A total of five incident reports were reviewed since Youth N’s
admission to Vista Maria that suggest she experiences auditory
and visual hallucinations, some involving a person named Staff 0.
INCIDENT REPORT 1
An incident report spanning a 5-hour time period on 9/6/23
indicated Youth N sat on the floor screaming “Staff 0 is back to get
4

her.” She told Former Staff 4 that Staff 0 was telling her to do bad
things to people again. Youth N attempted to pull an electrical
plate off the wall. Former Staff 4 attempted to verbally deescalate,
but Youth N ignored her and started hitting the wall. A “clear” was
called. Youth N appeared calm but minutes later, attempted to
self-harm saying, “Staff 0 told her to do it.” Youth N picked up a
chair, banged it on the wall and said she felt like hurting someone.
She asked to be taken to Children's Hospital. A nurse approved
her prn medication. The psychiatrist was notified and placed
Youth N on 100% observation status. At 9:15pm, Youth N
entered her room and began banging on the wall screaming, "Staff
0 is back.” Youth N was given support and food and had no
further issues that evening.
INCIDENT REPORT 2
An incident report dated 1/26/24 indicated Youth N would not
follow staff directives, tore the key reader off the wall and
attempted to remove the screws from the plug panels. Staff 5
prevented her from removing the screws. Youth N yelled, "Move
bitch before I spit on you," walked to her room and tried to rip the
electric socket off the wall. Then Youth N went into the bathroom,
threw soap on the floor and attempted to remove the soap
dispenser from the wall. Staff 3, Supervisor 1, Staff 5 and Staff 6
responded. Youth N left the bathroom and paced using profanity
and refusing directives to go to her room. Youth N removed the
wall plate and screw off the wall, put the screw in her mouth and
swallowed it before staff could remove it from her hand. Manager
and pediatrician were notified. Miralax was ordered and accepted
by Youth N. Psychiatrist and therapist were notified. Youth N was
placed on 100% observation status for safety.
Supervisor 1’s employee file contained no disciplinary write-ups.
Staff 3’s employee file contained verbal and written warnings
(6/12/23 and 7/24/23 respectively) for attendance and punctuality,
and a final warning on 10/23/23 for his potential use of a cell
phone around/with clients.
Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant on 2/12/24. She said Youth N alleged
a male staff named Staff 0 at Vista Maria sexually abused her and
she had no additional information.
I notified Youth N’s Foster Care Worker of the investigation, and
she expressed no additional licensing concerns.
5

I interviewed Rights Officer jointly with Government Worker 1 via
Teams on 3/1/24. He indicated Youth N has had three psychiatric
hospitalizations since she was placed at Vista Maria on 6/7/23.
Her most recent inpatient stay was from 1/30/24 – 2/15/24 at
Kingswood Psychiatric Hospital.
Rights Officer identified Supervisor 2 was hired on 9/11/23 after
Youth N made the first allegation addressed in August 2023, but
before she made the second allegation addressed in this report.
Supervisor 2 works midnight shift and makes nightly rounds to
Youth N’s building (Freedom Center) but his office is not stationed
there. Supervisor 2 also responds to calls for assistance
throughout the campus. He was described as a 60-year-old bald
African American man, and does not fit the physical description of
Staff 0 as described by Youth N.
Rights Officer said Staff 3 was hired on 3/20/23 and works
dayshift in Freedom Center where Youth N resides. He is
described as a 33-year-old tall, thin African American man with
long dreadlocks, and does not fit the physical description of Staff 0
as described by Youth N.
I interviewed Supervisor 2 jointly with Government Worker 1 via
Teams on 3/6/24. His first name is consistent with the first name
of Staff 0. However, his age and race do not fit the description of
the alleged perpetrator. Supervisor 2 is a midnight campus
supervisor hired on 9/11/23. He said he rounds the residential
building at night to monitor and support the staff but rarely
interacts with youths and does not go onto the sleeping wings. I
asked if he is familiar with Youth N. Supervisor 2 said he would
not recognize her and has had no verbal or physical contact with
her.
INCIDENT REPORT 1
I interviewed Former Staff 4 via phone on 3/21/24 who resigned
over six months ago. She said she did not know a Staff 0 and
never saw any male staff sexually abuse or touch Youth N’s
breasts inappropriately while restraining her.
INCIDENT REPORT 2
I interviewed Supervisor 1 jointly with Government Worker 1 and
Rights Officer present on 3/4/24. He does not normally work in
the building where Youth N resides but has picked up extra shifts
there. Supervisor 1 vaguely recalled the incident documented on
1/26/24. He said he was on the wing to provide support and never
6

physically restrained Youth N. He has heard Youth N hallucinates
but he has not seen it. Supervisor 1 said he does not know any
staff named Staff 0 and has never heard any male staff make
inappropriate comments or use improper restraint techniques with
Youth N.
I interviewed Staff 3 jointly with Government Worker and Rights
Officer on 3/4/24. He has worked dayshift for seven months in
Youth N’s residential building and has never worked the midnight
shift. Staff 3’s surname and age are similar to Staff 0’s, but his
race is different from the description Youth N provided. Staff 3
recalled the incident documented on 1/26/24. He said he was
called to the wing; Youth N had a chair in her hands and he and a
staff he did not know removed it from her. Staff 3 said he
remained on the wing for 20 or 30 minutes and denied ever
restraining Youth N, saying anything sexual to her or ever being
alone with her in her room.
On 2/8/24 Former Staff 2 was terminated for an unrelated matter
and deemed unsuitable to work with children. I interviewed her
via phone on 3/22/24. Former Staff 2 denied being present for
INCIDENT 2. She acknowledged that Youth N hears voices in her
head telling her to commit suicide but denied ever hearing the
youth mention a Staff 0. “I don’t even know a Staff 0,” she added.
I interviewed Staff 5 via phone on 3/22/24. She said she does not
know Staff 0 but does knows Staff 3 who has a similar last name.
Staff 5 recalled INCIDENT 2 and denied seeing Staff 3 sexually
abuse Youth N, restrain her, or touch her breasts.
I interviewed Staff 6 via phone on 3/22/24 with Rights Officer
present. She recalled INCIDENT 2 and said Staff 3 did not
restrain or touch Youth N inappropriately. Staff 6 said she is not
aware of a staff named Staff 0.
Government Worker 1 had no findings.
Analysis Documents indicate Youth N has had multiple psychiatric
hospitalizations and periodically experiences auditory and visual
hallucinations that involve a reoccurring theme of being touched
inappropriately by someone named Staff 0.
This is the second allegation made by Youth N with no evidence
that a male named Staff 0 sexually abused her. There are still no
male staff working at Vista Maria who fit Youth N’s physical
description of Staff 0.
7

CONSULTATION
I recommended Youth N be considered for a transfer to Vista
Maria’s Rose Hall that provides more intensive psychiatric
treatment, if and when a bed becomes available.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
